text: Phasa Willk'i (Aymara phasa edible earth, willk'i gap, "phasa gap", also spelled Pasa Willkhi, Phasa Willkhi) is a mountain in a volcanic complexGabriela Vargas-Mattos, Mauro César Geraldes, Ramiro Matos Salinas, Reconstrucción geológica del volcán Chullcani (mioceno superior a plioceno superior): Consideraciónes generales sobre geoquímica y edad de las fases volcánicas, Andes Centrales de Bolivia, Revista Brasileira de Geociências, 12/2006 in the Cordillera Occidental in the Andes of Bolivia. It is situated in the Oruro Department, Sajama Province, Turco Municipality. Phasa Willk'i lies southwest of Asu Asuni and Turi Turini. The Jaruma River originates east of the mountain. It flows to the south. == References == Category:Mountains of Oruro Department
title: Phasa Willk'i
